name: Work and Family Program
description: They empower workers who are parents, pregnant, family caregivers, or caring for their own health to access time off from work, paid leave, and other workplace accommodations. They offer free, confidential advice through their Work & Family helpline, represent individuals in low-income jobs and industries, and advocate for systems and policy change to advance the rights of working families by partnering with families, healthcare and social service providers, and government agencies.
